schema.description: Contains information about a collection.

contractId.description: The unique identifier for the contract with Akamai under which you provision the collection.

description.description: The description that you provide for the collection. If you specify an empty string in the request or omit this member from the object, the JSON response reflects it as `null`.

dirty.description: Whether the collection contains changes that are being propagated to the Akamai network.

dirtyACL.description: The endpoints or resources with ACL changes that are being propagated to the Akamai network.

grantedACL.description: The endpoints, resources, and HTTP methods accessible to API consumers that identify with keys included in the collection.

groupId.description: The unique identifier for the group in Control Center under which you provision the collection.

id.description: The unique identifier for the collection.

keyCount.description: The number of keys included in the collection.

name.description: The name of the collection.

quota.description: Contains information about quota settings for the collection.

enabled.description: Whether you enabled quota settings in the collection.

headers.description: Contains information about the criteria for sending the quota limit response headers.

allowLimitHeaderShown.description: Whether to send the `X-RateLimit-Limit` header in a response when the quota remains.

allowRemainingHeaderShown.description: Whether to send the `X-RateLimit-Remaining` header in a response when the quota remains.

allowResetHeaderShown.description: Whether to send the `X-RateLimit-Reset` header in a response when the quota remains.

denyLimitHeaderShown.description: Whether to send the `X-RateLimit-Limit` header in a response when the quota is full.

denyNextHeaderShown.description: Whether to send the `X-RateLimit-Next` header in a response when the quota is full.

denyRemainingHeaderShown.description: Whether to send the `X-RateLimit-Remaining` header in a response when the quota is full.

interval.description: The time period for the quota limit in UTC, either `HOUR_1` to reset at the start of each hour, `HOUR_6` at the start of each sixth hour, `HOUR_12` for twice daily, `DAY` for midnight each day, `WEEK` for midnight on each Monday, or `MONTH` for midnight on the first day of each month.

value.description: The number of requests that each key from the collection can send to an API within the specified time period.

example.description: A collection with API keys for use by the Bookstore API premium users.
example.name: Bookstore Premium Access

schema.description: The endpoints, resources, and HTTP methods in an access control list. An endpoint item is composed of the `ENDPOINT-` prefix and the `apiEndpointId` value. A resource item is composed of the `RESOURCE-` prefix and the `apiResourceLogicId` value. A method item is composed of the `METHOD-` prefix and the `apiResourceMethodLogicId` value.

get.description: Returns information about all endpoints assigned to the contract and group under which you created the collection. The format of the response data for this operation is managed by the [API Endpoints API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/api-gateway/reference/api).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's API Keys and Traffic Management API

apiEndPointId.description: The unique identifier for the endpoint.

apiEndPointName.description: The name of the endpoint, unique within the account.

apiResourceBaseInfo.description: The collection of resource objects associated with the endpoint.

apiResourceId.description: The unique identifier for the resource.

apiResourceLogicId.description: The unique identifier for the resource across different endpoint versions.

methods.description: The collection of method objects associated with the resource.

apiResourceMethod.description: The core HTTP method to which the resource may respond, either `GET`, `PUT`, `POST`, `DELETE`, `HEAD`, `PATCH`, or `OPTIONS`.

apiResourceMethodId.description: The unique identifier for the resource's allowed method.

apiResourceMethodLogicId.description: The unique identifier for the resource's method across all endpoint versions.

private.description: Whether the resource method is private. API consumers can access resources with private method only if they identify with an appropriate API key.

productionVersion.description: Contains information about an endpoint version's activation status on the staging network.

status.description: The activation status on the production network, either `PENDING` if the version contains changes that are being propagated to the network, `ACTIVE` if the version is active, `DEACTIVATED` if the version had been active once but has been deactivated, or `FAILED` if an activation or deactivation attempt for this version has failed. The value is `null` for versions that have never been activated on this network.

stagingVersion.description: Contains information about an endpoint version's activation status on the staging network.

status.description: The activation status on the production network, either `PENDING` if the version contains changes that are being propagated to the network, `ACTIVE` if the version is active, `DEACTIVATED` if the version had been active once but has been deactivated, or `FAILED` if an activation or deactivation attempt for this version has failed. The value is `null` for versions that have never been activated on this network.

schema.description: Contains information about a throttling counter.

contractId.description: The unique identifier for the contract with Akamai under which you created the throttling counter.

description.description: The description that you provide for the throttling counter. If you specify an empty string in the request or omit this member from the object, the JSON response reflects it as `null`.

enabled.description: Whether you enabled the throttling counter.

errorResponse.description: Contains information about a customizable error response.

body.description: The response body to return in case of the error. The value should have the proper formatting to reflect the content type. For example, in case of a JSON body format, enclose the text in curly brackets (`{}`). If you specify an empty string in the request or omit this member from the object, the JSON response reflects it as `null`.

headers.description: The list of HTTP headers to return in case of the error. By default, API Gateway returns the `Content-Type` header with a value of `application/problem+json` which reflects the default response body. If the `body` member indicates a different content type, set the `Content-Type` header to the appropriate value. For example, in case of an XML body, the value could be `application/problem+xml`.

name.description: The name of the HTTP header to return in case of the error.

value.description: The value of the HTTP header to return in case of the error.

overrideDefaults.description: Whether you overrode the default error response.

statusCode.description: The status code to return in case of the error.

groupId.description: The unique identifier for the group in Control Center under which you created the throttling counter.

headers.description: Contains information about the criteria for sending the throttling limit and rate HTTP headers. This value may appear as `null` if you don't specify any throttling headers.

sendLimitToClient.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Limit` header in a response to a client.

sendLimitToOrigin.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Limit` header to your origin.

sendRateToClient.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Rate` header in a response to a client.

sendRateToOrigin.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Rate` header to your origin.

id.description: The unique identifier for the throttling counter.

name.description: The name that you provide for the throttling counter.

onOverLimit.description: The instruction for edge servers on how to handle excessive requests when a throttling limit is reached. Either `DENY` to reject excessive requests, or `WARN` to send an alert when excessive requests reach edge servers.

ownerInfo.description: Contains information about the owner of the counter.

accountId.description: A unique identifier for an account.

contractTypeId.description: A unique identifier for a contract type.

identity.description: A unique identifier for a user.

rules.description: The throttling conditions that cause the counter to increment.

items.description: Contains information about a set of throttling conditions that cause the throttling counter to increment. This value may appear as `null` if you don't specify any conditions.

id.description: The unique identifier for the throttling condition.

type.description: The type of the throttling condition. Either `KEY` for conditions associated with API keys, `KEY_COLLECTION` for conditions associated with API collections, or `ACL_ENTRY` for conditions associated with API endpoints, resources, or HTTP methods.

values.description: The specific values that trigger the throttling condition. If you selected `KEY` for the `type` member, specify API key integer IDs. If you selected `ACL_ENTRY` for the `type` member, specify strings that represent API endpoints, resources, or HTTP methods.

status.description: Specifies the status of throttling counter changes propagated on the Akamai network. `PENDING` means that changes are waiting to be propagated, `DIRTY` means that propagation of changes is in progress but has not yet finished, `ACTIVE` means that all changes have been propagated and counter settings are active throughout the Akamai network.

throttling.description: The value of the request-per-second limit associated with the throttling counter. If the request count reaches the defined limit, API Gateway rejects any excessive requests with a 429 response until the moving average for this throttling counter diminishes to the set threshold. This usually takes up to ten seconds.

example.description: A counter for requests to the books resource within the Bookstore API.
example.name: Books counter

schema.description: Contains information about a throttling counter.

contractId.description: The unique identifier for the contract with Akamai under which you created the throttling counter.

description.description: The description that you provide for the throttling counter. If you specify an empty string in the request or omit this member from the object, the JSON response reflects it as `null`.

enabled.description: Whether you enabled the throttling counter.

errorResponse.description: Contains information about a customizable error response.

body.description: The response body to return in case of the error. The value should have the proper formatting to reflect the content type. For example, in case of a JSON body format, enclose the text in curly brackets (`{}`). If you specify an empty string in the request or omit this member from the object, the JSON response reflects it as `null`.

headers.description: The list of HTTP headers to return in case of the error. By default, API Gateway returns the `Content-Type` header with a value of `application/problem+json` which reflects the default response body. If the `body` member indicates a different content type, set the `Content-Type` header to the appropriate value. For example, in case of an XML body, the value could be `application/problem+xml`.

name.description: The name of the HTTP header to return in case of the error.

value.description: The value of the HTTP header to return in case of the error.

overrideDefaults.description: Whether you overrode the default error response.

statusCode.description: The status code to return in case of the error.

groupId.description: The unique identifier for the group in Control Center under which you created the throttling counter.

headers.description: Contains information about the criteria for sending the throttling limit and rate HTTP headers. This value may appear as `null` if you don't specify any throttling headers.

sendLimitToClient.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Limit` header in a response to a client.

sendLimitToOrigin.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Limit` header to your origin.

sendRateToClient.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Rate` header in a response to a client.

sendRateToOrigin.description: Whether to send the `X-Throttling-Rate` header to your origin.

id.description: The unique identifier for the throttling counter.

name.description: The name that you provide for the throttling counter.

onOverLimit.description: The instruction for edge servers on how to handle excessive requests when a throttling limit is reached. Either `DENY` to reject excessive requests, or `WARN` to send an alert when excessive requests reach edge servers.

ownerInfo.description: Contains information about the owner of the counter.

accountId.description: A unique identifier for an account.

contractTypeId.description: A unique identifier for a contract type.

identity.description: A unique identifier for a user.

rules.description: The throttling conditions that cause the counter to increment.

items.description: Contains information about a set of throttling conditions that cause the throttling counter to increment. This value may appear as `null` if you don't specify any conditions.

id.description: The unique identifier for the throttling condition.

type.description: The type of the throttling condition. Either `KEY` for conditions associated with API keys, `KEY_COLLECTION` for conditions associated with API collections, or `ACL_ENTRY` for conditions associated with API endpoints, resources, or HTTP methods.

values.description: The specific values that trigger the throttling condition. If you selected `KEY` for the `type` member, specify API key integer IDs. If you selected `ACL_ENTRY` for the `type` member, specify strings that represent API endpoints, resources, or HTTP methods.

status.description: Specifies the status of throttling counter changes propagated on the Akamai network. `PENDING` means that changes are waiting to be propagated, `DIRTY` means that propagation of changes is in progress but has not yet finished, `ACTIVE` means that all changes have been propagated and counter settings are active throughout the Akamai network.

throttling.description: The value of the request-per-second limit associated with the throttling counter. If the request count reaches the defined limit, API Gateway rejects any excessive requests with a 429 response until the moving average for this throttling counter diminishes to the set threshold. This usually takes up to ten seconds.

Either `NONE` if no quota reset is in progress, `QUEUED` if the key is awaiting a quota reset, or `PROCESSING` if the key's quota is currently being reset. When the quota resets, the status automatically changes from `PROCESSING` to `NONE`.

quotaUsage.description: The current quota usage for the key. The value is `-1` if the current usage is unknown.

quotaUsageTimestamp.description: Indicates when the key's quota was updated, in ISO 8601 format.

revokedAt.description: Indicates when the key was revoked, in ISO 8601 format.

tags.description: The additional categories assigned to the key that you can use as filters.

terminationAt.description: Indicates when to delete the key, in ISO 8601 format.

value.description: The value of the key.

createdAt.description: Indicates when the key was created, in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: The description that you provide for the key.

dirty.description: Whether changes to the key's status are being propagated to the Akamai network.

id.description: The unique identifier for the key.

incrementLabel.description: Whether to append an automatic increment to the label of each key. A label's increment starts with an underscore character followed by a numerical value based on the number of keys that you create. For example, if you create eight keys, the increments range from `_1` to `_8`. If you create 125 keys, the increments range from `_001` to `_125`.

label.description: The label that you assign to the key. If you specify an empty string in the request or omit this member from the object, the JSON response reflects it as `null`.

revokedAt.description: Indicates when the key was revoked, in ISO 8601 format.

tags.description: The additional categories assigned to the key that you can use as filters.

terminationAt.description: Indicates when to delete the key, in ISO 8601 format.

value.description: The values of the keys. If you want to create more than one key, separate the values by commas, semicolons, or newline sequences (`\n`). The maximum length of the string is 10000 characters, but each individual key inside it can be up to 64 characters long.

tags.description: The additional categories assigned to the key that you can use as filters.

post.description: Creates a report in a JSON format for a specific version of a report. You can specify the `start` and `end` date for the report data and the aggregation `interval` for each record.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's API Keys and Traffic Management API

schema.description: Contains information about the available report filters and objects to report on.

filters.description: Contains information about the custom quota reports filter, with the filter's name keying an array containing the filter's set of values.

api_key.description: The list of API key identifiers.

schema.description: Contains the response report, including aggregated data and reflecting details on the request.

data.description: The list of report data rows suitable for aggregation. The value of the `groupBy` array serves as a key for each row to indicate the metric by which the row is grouped and sorted.

items.description: Contains information about the report data rows suitable for aggregation. The value of the `groupBy` array serves as a key for each row to indicate the metric by which the row is grouped and sorted.

api_key.description: The API key description and the API key identifier in parentheses.

apikeyCollection.description: The maximum quota allowed per API key and the quota interval in a given key collection.

quotaUsage.description: The quota used by an API key in a given period.

startdatetime.description: Indicates the start of each record in a report, in ISO 8601 format.

time_interval.description: The identifier for the quota interval, either `0` for an hour, `1` for six hours, `2` for twelve hours, `3` for a day, `4` for a week, or `5` for a month.

metadata.description: Contains information about the requested data set based on the request's parameters and the contents of the query object. Provides information for use in the report output.

availableDataEnds.description: For unfinalized report data, the ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the data is available. Otherwise, the value is `null` for finalized data.

columns.description: The list of interface labels for the `data` member.

label.description: The interface label to assign to the corresponding `name` member.

name.description: The name of the corresponding `data` member.

end.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the end date for the requested data. This reflects the value of the [Generate a report](https://techdocs.akamai.com/key-traffic-mgmt/reference/post-report) operation's `end` parameter.

filters.description: The list of filters explicitly provided by the user and implicitly resolved, used when retrieving the report data.

name.description: The name of the filter specified in the request or included in the default set for a given report type.

value.description: The list of requested filter values.

groupBy.description: The list of fields by which `data` is grouped and sorted. The `groupBy` field is specified in each `data` row.

interval.description: The duration of each record in the report, either `FIVE_MINUTES`, `HOUR`, `DAY`, `WEEK`, or `MONTH`. This reflects the value of the [Generate a report](https://techdocs.akamai.com/key-traffic-mgmt/reference/post-report) operation's `interval` parameter.

name.description: The name of the current report type.

objectIds.description: The list of internal identifiers related to reports. For quota reports, the array always contains a single entry: `ymdfile`.

objectType.description: The internal identifier related to reports. For quota reports, the value is always `rapidfile`.

rowCount.description: The total number of `data` records included in the report.

start.description: Indicates the start date for the requested data, in ISO 8601 format. This reflects the value of the [Generate a report](https://techdocs.akamai.com/key-traffic-mgmt/reference/post-report) operation's `start` parameter.

suggestedRetryTime.description: For unfinalized report data, indicates the estimated report completion date, in ISO 8601 format. Otherwise, the value is `null` for finalized data.

uri.description: The URL called to get the report data.

version.description: The version of the current report type.

summaryStatistics.description: Contains summary statistics for a report. This isn't applicable for quota reports and is always empty.

400.description: Invalid report request. Appropriate message is returned.

parameters.description: Indicates the start date for the report, in ISO 8601 format.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Indicates the end date for the report data, in ISO 8601 format. Any data that matches the `end` value's timestamp is excluded from the `rapidkey-by-time` report. The `rapidkey-by-quota` report displays data only for the date indicated by this timestamp.
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: __Enum__ The duration of each data record, either `FIVE_MINUTES`, `HOUR`, `DAY`, `WEEK`, or `MONTH`. The support for specific interval values may vary depending on the report type.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.name: reportVersion

parameters.description: __Enum__ The type of report that you want to generate. Either `rapidkey-by-quota` or `rapidkey-by-time`.
parameters.name: reportName
